theoryTitle: Usopp's Love Created the Going Merry's Klabautermann
theoryText: Fan theory suggests that Usopp's deep love and care for the Going Merry was the primary catalyst for the ship developing a Klabautermann. While the whole crew loved the ship, Usopp's role as the unofficial shipwright and his constant repairs and maintenance gave the ship the devotion needed to manifest a spirit. This is why Usopp was the first to see the Klabautermann in Water 7 and the first to recognize its voice in episode 310.
theorist: Various fans across Reddit and forums
evidencePoints: Usopp was the first to see the Klabautermann repairing the ship in Skypiea
Usopp fought the crew to prevent them from abandoning the Going Merry
Usopp was the first to recognize the Going Merry's voice calling to them
The Going Merry's spirit has a childlike voice, similar to how Usopp saw it as a child

theoryTitle: The Klabautermann Could Appear on the Thousand Sunny
theoryText: Some fans theorize that the Thousand Sunny, being built with even more love and care by Franky and maintained by the Straw Hats, could eventually develop its own Klabautermann. The theory suggests that by the end of the series, the Thousand Sunny might manifest a spirit similar to the Going Merry, especially as the crew's bonds strengthen and they face more trials together.
evidencePoints: The Going Merry developed a Klabautermann through the crew's love and care
Franky built the Thousand Sunny with even more dedication and superior materials
The Straw Hats have had many more adventures and bonded even more deeply with the Sunny
Oda has shown that ships can develop spirits when properly loved

theoryTitle: The Going Merry's Final Journey Was Impossible Without Divine Intervention
theoryText: Fans debate whether the Going Merry's journey from Water 7 to Enies Lobby was purely the result of the Klabautermann's power, or if there was some form of divine or supernatural intervention. Some theorize that the ship's journey represents a miracle beyond just the Klabautermann - possibly influenced by the will of the sea itself or a greater power in the One Piece world that rewards genuine bonds and love.
evidencePoints: The Going Merry was confirmed to be beyond repair and unseaworthy
The ship navigated through a Buster Call and dangerous Grand Line waters autonomously
The timing of the arrival was impossibly perfect
Iceberg stated the ship should have sunk long before reaching Enies Lobby
